fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28826].
  {panel}

When ordering by fixVersion in the Issue Navigator, it seems to incorrectly order by the ID ({{projectversion.id}}) rather than the name ({{projectversion.vname}}).

h5. To replicate:

# Create version 1-3.
# Create 3 issues.
# Assign version 1 to issue 1 and so on for the 3 issues.
# Go to the issue navigator and check the ordering of them (may need to modify columns). Example screenie attached.
# Go back to the project version and change version 2 to 8.
# Search again. Order is wrong, as per screenie.
fields.summary: Order version fields by their order on the configuration screen

fields.description:
To reproduce: 
Attempt to go to non-existing field screen scheme configuration, e.g.
http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/admin/ConfigureFieldScreenScheme.jspa?id=10100 (assuming you're running on localhost:2990/jira and there is no field screen scheme with id=10100.

Result: 500 error page with stack trace:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap.putIfAbsent(ConcurrentHashMap.java:896)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.DefaultFieldScreenSchemeManager.getFieldScreenScheme(DefaultFieldScreenSchemeManager.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.AbstractFieldScreenSchemeAction.getFieldScreenScheme(AbstractFieldScreenSchemeAction.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.AbstractFieldScreenSchemeAction.validateId(AbstractFieldScreenSchemeAction.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.ConfigureFieldScreenScheme.doValidation(ConfigureFieldScreenScheme.java:28)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:391)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:82)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:221)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:150)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:153)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.ChainedFilterStepRunner.doFilter(ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:78)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28824].
  {panel}

For some production JIRA-only instances, the "Import & Export" section is missing in the admin screen. Apart from the missing admin menu items in that section (which is "External System Import"), this also has implications for bundling the Backup Manager plugin for JIRA, since the menu item for that plugin is supposed to appear under that section.

[~mknight@atlassian.com] noticed this with a production 149 JIRA-only instance, and subsequent inspection of more production and development instances gave us the following observations:

* Out of 6 JIRA-only instances that were *upgraded* to 149, 5 of them have that section missing, one doesn't.
* Out of 3 JIRA-only instances that were *newly provisioned after 149 was released* (i.e. they were not upgraded), all of them still have that section.
* Inspection of one *non-JIRA-only* production 149 instance shows it still has that section
* An upgraded JIRA-only 149 dev instance has that section missing.
* A clean-installed JIRA-only 149 dev instance still has that section. 
* A clean-installed JIRA-only ondemand-master instance still has the section.
fields.summary: Some JIRA-only instances are missing the "Import & Export" admin menu section
Extend the JIRA Configuration Tool to guide the user with the proxy configuration
Wiki Comment preview does nothing

fields.description:
Observed on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26083

The two wiki links tell me "You do not have permission to view this page"
But when I click on the link, it works fine.

Furthermore, when I remove my Confluence OAuth tokens it continues to have the same message, not anything about "login and approve".
fields.summary: Remote Issue Link to Confluence tells me "You do not have permission to view this page" but this is not true

fields.description: The "Got feedback for the new look" issue collector appears to be displayed in the bottom right of JIRA (at least on the view issue screen - may be displayed on other screens).

fields.description:
Export of JIRA issues in XML format fails in case when project does not have a Priority field available. It returns a HTTP 400 error code:

HTTP Status 400 - Not able to sort using field 'priority'.

XML export fails for both JQL and old-style queries.

What's interesting, it works for HTML view.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a project with a Priority field not associated to any issue type
2) Create an issue in the project
3) From Issue Navigator select Filters>Most important (it works), next Views>XMLOpen (it fails)

Sample URL:
/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+ABC+AND+resolution+%3D+Unresolved+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC&tempMax=1000


Workaround:
Associate Priority field with issue type.
fields.summary: XML export fails with 400 Bad Request when Priority field is not available
bulk issue editing of fields with multiple values overwrite all values in selected field.

fields.description:
If we try to transition an issue after inline editing an issue field, the issue will not be refreshed and the status will not be updated. Hence, the workflow button will remain the same, and if we try to execute the same workflow operation again, Workflow Action Invalid error will be thrown.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new issue.
# Try to inline edit any of the issue field (eg: Summary, Description, etc) using the shortcut key (,). Save the changes made.
# Then if we try to transition an issue, the request is actually being sent, but the issue is not automatically updated. 
# If we manually refresh the issue, we can see that actually the issue status has changed.

There could be a conflict between the inline editing and fewer page reloads feature.

Tested on:
- Google Chrome 19
- Mozilla Firefox 13
- IE 9

Let's test this.  Let's test this again
fields.summary: Problem transitioning an issue after inline editing an issue field

fields.description:
+Steps to reproduce:+

* Create new project
* Note that it is associated with the default workflow
* Edit the default workflow (the system copies it to a new one for you)
* Make changes to the workflow from the text view (e.g. remove all transitions to In Progress status)
* Publish the workflow
* Check the Diagram (Workflow Designer View); you should not see your changes
* Edit the workflow; you should *see* your changes
* Discard the draft; you should *not see* the changes
* Edit and save the draft; you should *not see* the changes
* Download as XML; your changes are in there

+Note:+
If you have an issue in _In Progress_ status (and then you edit your workflow) you will indeed see that you cannot transition it. So the workflow is actually active, *you just do not see your changes in the diagram*. Other than that, the workflow seems to work just fine.
fields.summary: Workflow changes not shown in Workflow Designer (Diagram button)

fields.description:
Embeded pictures/screenshots to not render correct, if the name of the fle includes a issue key. Jira renders those keys as links to the issue instead of embeding the picture/screenshot.

fields.summary: Screenshots are not rendered if filename equals issue key

fields.description:
First go and read through this issue because I am encountering the same problem: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4422

Let the 'source' instance refer to the instance we export from and 'target' refer to the instance that we import into.

When I do an export from the source the entities.xml file is missing the FieldLayoutSchemeAssociation elements. Therefore, any projects that I have assosiated with Field Configuration Schemes that are not the default Field Configuration Scheme are not exported (and thus not present when we import them into the target).

You can reproduce this problem by creating a Field Configuration Scheme, associating it with a project, exporting the data, importing the data and then noting that the project has reverted to using the default configuration scheme instead of the one you created.

I have attatched screenshots showing how you go about creating an association. If you need any more information I would be happy to provide it.
fields.summary: Export missing associations: Regression in FieldLayoutSchemeAssociation
Cannot edit archived versions in the new field Edit.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28805].
  {panel}

Current it's possible to enter a user object filter or group object filter that exceeds the limitations of the database schema {{cwd_directory_attribute.attribute_value}} is a varchar(255). Can you look at adding this limitation into the JIRA GUI to prevent users from encountering a data truncation error in the logs? For example:

{noformat:title=atlassian-jira.log}
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.db.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:DirectoryAttribute][directoryId,10100][name,ldap.user.filter][value,(&(objectclass=unicornRider)(!(ou:dn:=Guardians of The Globe))(|(memberof=cn=Lightning Strike Thunderdome,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=jiradmins,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=strikeforceone,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=UAT,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers)(memberof=cn=myspace,ou=Groups,ou=The Avengers))] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO cwd_directory_attribute (directory_id, attribute_name, attribute_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'attribute_value' at row 1))
...
{noformat}

h3. To replicate

# Add a new User Directory to JIRA.
# Add a very long object or group filter.
# Attempt to synchronise, this will fail with a "Data truncation" error.

h3. Workaround

Please refer to the [Data Truncation due to Data too long for column|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/4I2GE] KB article.
fields.summary: Prevent data from exceeding the database limitations when configuring User Directories

fields.description:

Two minor things:

* "Add it now" - feels like its screaming at me, and we repeat it so often. Can we change it to a simple "Add"? We don't really postfix any of our actions with "Now".. we don't say "Create issue now" for creating an issue

* Can we make the Gadget URL's look a little bit more appealing? Problems right now:
** It looks silly when it's cut off, there is no indication there is more in the link 
Suggestion:
** Change it to say "Gadget Link" or
** Put a "..." at the end of the string if it doesn't fit in the macro browser 

* There seems to be a "forced" new blank line after every gadget link that is not necessary

https://skitch.com/sherif/erays/skitched-20120704-113117

fields.description:
In {{IssueMailQueueItem}}, when the call to {{getIssueContextParams()}} is made, {{jiraAuthenticationContext.getLoggedInUser()}} has not yet been set.

This needs to be made on a per-recipient basis. See JRA-28796.

Since the logged in user isn't being explicitly set, when an admin manually flushes the mail queue, any code (e.g. plugins) involved in rendering mail that calls {{jiraAuthenticationContext.getLoggedInUser()}} will receive the admin.
fields.summary: User not set when creating mail context parameters

fields.description:
I would expect something like

jira.permission.subtasks.create.denied

or 

jira.permission.subtasks.create.group

to work.

While JIRA accepts the parameter, it does not seem to apply it. This seems to be due to the outstanding implmentation of JRA-10077.
fields.summary: Workflow permission subtask create parameters not working (jira.permission.subtasks.create.*)

fields.description: {{sendLists()}} currently takes only one {{contextParams}} object for all the users it sends mail to. However, {{contextParams}} may be different per user (e.g. some users may be able to see more than others).
fields.summary: The context parameters being passed in to the MailingListCompiler.sendLists() should be differentiable per user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28794].
  {panel}

If you type a short phrase into the quick search box, the resulting JQL is pretty difficult to modify subsequently:

bq. (summary ~ "some text" OR description ~ "some text" OR comment ~ "some text")

It would be nicer if a quick search was turned into a simple text search across all the issue's text:

bq. text ~ "some text"

To ensure the quick search is still compatible with both the search builder and the JQL view, we'd probably also have to add a checkbox for "All text" under the free text search field in the search builder UI.

Something for the kick-ass effort, perhaps?
fields.summary: Quick search should expand to JQL [text ~ "some text"] not [(summary ~ "some text" OR description ~ "some text" OR comment ~ "some text")]
Rename View Version Control Permission to Display Source Tabs On Issues or something like that

fields.description:
The adding and editing of labels can be removed through removing Labels from the appropriate screen.

If the labels option is still in the dropdown but not on the edit screen, we should still give the ability to inline edit labels.

At the very least we should show the pencil icon on hover.

h3. Workaround

As per our [Configuring a screen's tabs and fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-Configuringascreen'stabsandfields] documentation, add the Labels field to the appropriate screen (typically the Default).

Symptoms:

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* activate issue linking
* link one issue to another so that the 'Issue Links' sections displays on the view issue screen
* find the Field Configuration for that issue's context (project/issue type) and hide the Linked Issues field on that Configuration
* go back to view issue and the 'Issue Links' section is still showing.

All other system field except for issue type and status are honouring the Field Configuration setting
fields.summary: Issue links render on view issue regardless of the field layout (A.K.A. field configuration) settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28781].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in the introduction gadget. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

We would like to come up with a secure compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the introduction gadget for. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using the introduction gadget by asking you to comment on this issue.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand introduction gadget
JIRA to act as a SAML Service Provider in order to integrate into existing SAML-based SSO

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28779].
  {panel}

At the moment, JIRA activity stream will display commits from FishEye if:
* the repository's permission is configured to "anonymous".  This can be prevented by configuring the repo's permission to specific group(s).  
* user has permission to view the repository when each JIRA project is configured to retrieve information from different repository path using the Include/Exclude feature in FishEye.

It would be convenience for the users to have an additional configuration on the JIRA side to prevent commits messages on the Activity Stream.  

One user suggests

{quote}
My personal preference for the behaviour:

* global permission for "View Version Control" -> user can see commits from all projects, that he has permission for in fisheye (default: deactivated ). If activated, the system would behave as it does now..
* optional: project permission "View Version Control" => user can see only commits, that are targeted for his project ( fisheye permission is granted + jira has identified this commit as belonging to the project, i.e. commit contains issue id for this project)

This setup would avoid information leaks to jira due to anonymous access to fisheye.

In our scenario, jira is open to the internet and fisheye is not -> anonymous access to fisheye is ok for internal use, but jira should not show commits by default.
{quote}
fields.summary: Activity Stream Configuration for revision control system Commits
Plain description and comment text is misinterpreting backslashes that occur before an underscore so that "\_" is rendered as "_"
Filter with !~ or "not in" does not consider empty fields or Resolution "Unresolved"
Allow HTML to the custom field's Description or the Introduction message (to display on the dashboard)

fields.description:
Version affected assumed due to using the Atlassian hosted environment.

We change locale settings under Look and Feel to read the following for dates and times:

Time Format	HH:mm
Day Format	EEEE HH:mm
Complete Date/Time Format	dd-MMM-yyyy HH:mm
Day/Month/Year Format	dd-MMM-yyyy

Which is the common way to format these for nl_NL.

Yet after setting these, the Time Tracking date picker still uses am/pm with time and slashes for dates. The same applies for the Due Date in Create Issue.

On one particular page, cannot remember which right now, the date won't accept the localized version, but *requires* you to use DD/MM/YY.
fields.summary: Date and time format localisation not used in many areas of Jira
Upgrade JIRA Toolkit Plugin to latest version in OnDemand

fields.description:
Copied to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-992

We have noticed a behaviour where two applications located across different time zones with applinks connecting them have a weird situation where resource sharing fails with the error below:

{noformat}
012-06-19 14:49:52,318 http-8443-36 WARN anonymous 889x58167x1 - 63.246.18.90,127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/oauth/request-token [serviceprovider.internal.servlet.RequestTokenServlet] Rejecting OAuth request for url "https://jira.sultan.com/plugins/servlet/oauth/request-token" due to invalid timestamp ({oauth_problem=timestamp_refused, oauth_acceptable_timestamps=1340109892318-1340110492318}). This is most likely due to our system clock not being synchronized with the consumer's clock.
2012-06-19 14:50:39,559 http-8443-30 WARN alexandre.alquier@sultan.com 890x58179x1 pocngl 82.127.114.234,127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] Unable to respond to any of these challenges: {oauth=OAuth realm="https%3A%2F%2Fsultan.onconfluence.com", oauth_problem="consumer_key_unknown"}
2012-06-19 14:50:39,559 http-8443-30 ERROR alexandre.alquier@sultan.com 890x58179x1 pocngl 82.127.114.234,127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize [core.auth.oauth.OAuthApplinksServlet] An error occurred when performing the oauth 'dance' for application link 'sultan (d138ac5b-109f-389b-a6fd-ed6acf8b5a80) https://sultan.onconfluence.com com.atlassian.applinks.application.confluence.ConfluenceApplicationTypeImpl@7db75f15'
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Failed to get token from service provider, problem was: 'consumer_key_unknown', full details: OAuth realm="https%3A%2F%2Fsultan.onconfluence.com", OAuth realm="https%3A%2F%2Fsultan.onconfluence.com", oauth_problem="consumer_key_unknown"
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.oauth.OAuthTokenRetriever$1.handle(OAuthTokenRetriever.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest$1.handle(JerseyRequest.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest$1.handle(JerseyRequest.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest$2.handle(JerseyRequest.java:163)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.executeAndReturn(HttpClientRequest.java:307)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.executeAndReturn(JerseyRequest.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.execute(JerseyRequest.java:138)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.ContextClassLoaderSwitchingProxy.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSwitchingProxy.java:27)
	at $Proxy1365.execute(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

Common features effected by this issue is gadget subscription between JIRA and the other application such as confluence.

*Workaround*

Modify the timezones to match as per our [Setting the timezone for the JAVA environment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+the+timezone+for+the+JAVA+environment] KB.
fields.summary: Resource sharing between two applications located on different timezone doesn't work

fields.description:
# Create an assignable user called "z". This should be the only user that has a "z" in their username, full user name or email address.
# Open the assign dialog. Don't open the drop down.
# Type in "z". You should now have only one user in the "All Users" group.
# Clear the "z" from the search.
# (BUG) Hit the down arrow. You will notice that the "All Users" group is now first rather than the "Suggestions" group. 

!swapped.png!

I would expect the "Suggestions" group to always be first.
fields.summary: The order of the "Suggestions" and "All Users" groups and become reversed in the assignee dropdown

fields.description:
The "Start Typing for Users" hint in the assignee dropdown is a footer of the "Suggestions" group. This means it is tied to suggestions groups. This can make things a little strange if there are suggestions and you have typed something, it will still say "Start Typing for Users"

!typed_already.png!

I would expect the "hint" to disappear once I have started typing for users.
fields.summary: The "Start Typing for Users" hint in the assignee dropdown displays and hides randomly

fields.description:
The user_profile_fisheye_prefs web item in the jira-ondemand-theme-plugin:5.0.6 contains the following conditions:

{code}
<web-item key="user_profile_fisheye_prefs" name="Source Preferences" section="system.user.profile.links/operations"
          i18n-name-key="weblink.fisheye.prefs.name" system="true" weight="83">
    <label key="weblink.fisheye.prefs.name"/>
    <tooltip key=""/>
    <link linkId="view_fisheye_prefs" absolute="true">${applicationBase}/profile</link>
    <context-provider class="com.atlassian.studio.jira.web.contexts.ApplinksContext">
        <param name="application">FISHEYE</param>
    </context-provider>
    <condition class="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.conditions.UserLoggedInCondition"/>
    <condition class="com.atlassian.studio.jira.webfragment.conditions.UserCanAccessAllAppsCondition"/>
    <condition class="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.conditions.UserIsTheLoggedInUserCondition"/>
    <condition class="com.atlassian.studio.jira.webfragment.conditions.FisheyeAppLinkExistsCondition"/>
</web-item>
{code}


This:     <condition class="com.atlassian.studio.jira.webfragment.conditions.UserCanAccessAllAppsCondition"/>

means that if a user can access fisheye and crucible however NOT Bamboo, then they will be unable to access their Source and Reviews User Profile.

An example of this is if you login as mark/mark to https://fe-2-7-13-upgrade.jira-dev.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa .

The user mark does not have access to Bamboo.

!profile.png!
fields.summary: IF a user does not have Access to All Applications, they can not reach their FishEye or Crucible User Profile.
A typo in initDialogs.js overwrites Assign To dialog with Assign To Me dialog
data returned from autocomplete urls should have a more consistent shape

fields.description:
When JIRA is in atlassian.dev.mode, the velocity templates (which in dev.mode are re-created every time from the source files) are not freed after the page has been rendered. 

This leak leads to the Heap being exhausted really quickly during the normal debugging/testing session, so JIRA instance has to be restarted. I've a YourKit memory snapshot with ~5000 instances of velocity templates totalling 300+ MB.

I'm not sure if there are also bad effects in production mode - worth checking.

This was not happening in 5.0.
fields.summary: Velocity templates leak in development mode

ERROR MESSAGE

(Data truncation: Data too long for column 'STRINGVALUE' at row 1))

Option for No Default Project
Drag and dropping gadgets no longer work in versions 5+

fields.description:
Can't create issues using GMail IMAP. Use IMAP in this version or in a oldest one is not recommended. That's because in this time the IMAP was much newer than POP3 and it is a lot more complex wich makes POP3 easier at debugging.

If I try the same configuration in JIRA 4.4.4, everything works perfect!
fields.summary: Unable to configure GMail IMAP to create issues

fields.description:
I've noticed that, when creating a new ticket, the Description text field will shrink by a little bit with each character I type into the field until it shrinks to the minimum size that still lets me see the content I've typed.

This can be 'worked around' by manually resizing the field to be very tall. A subsequent key press will shrink it again, but to a fixed size, where it will remain and not resize itself further.

UPDATE: I can confirm that this is not the case on Chromium 20.0, which does not seem to suffer from this issue.
UPDATE: I tried upgrading to Firefox 13.0, which still exhibits the issue.
fields.summary: 'Description' text box becomes smaller upon each key press.
Disable QuickIssueCreate lightbox via dialog

fields.description:
I have upgraded JIRA from version 4.1.1 to latest one and I have noticed that during "Edit" action all values from ReadOnly custom fields vanish. 
I have fixed it by adding "edit" resource to the all custom read only fields:
for example 
In system-customfieldtypes-plugin.xml file I have added the following line to the "importid" customfield section
{code}
<resource name="edit" type="velocity" location="templates/plugins/fields/edit/edit-readonly-basictext.vm"/>
{code}
and I've added new file based on existing edit-basictext.vm
{code:title=edit-readonly-basictext.vm}
#customControlHeader ($action $customField.id $customField.name $fieldLayoutItem.required $displayParameters $auiparams)
    <input class="text" id="$customField.id" name="$customField.id" type="text" value="$textutils.htmlEncode($!value)" readonly="readonly" />
#customControlFooter ($action $customField.id $fieldLayoutItem.fieldDescription $displayParameters $auiparams)
{code}

I have fixed it one day after upgrade so I had to recover only few issues but this very serious bug. I don't know whether it concerns only version 5.0.6 or maybe other previous versions.
fields.summary: Values of ReadOnly fields are deleted during update action.
Allow banner to be set with system property
When adding a multi checkbox field option, we still indicate to customers (on the UI) that HTML tags can be used, when in fact, they cannot (due to proper escaping).

fields.description:
These problems appear in JIRA.  I have not looked at other apps in OnDemand.

There are couple of things going on here depending on the browser.

* FF 13.0.1 / OSX - enter text in quick search that results in a dropdown of matches.  Use the arrow keys to highlight a match then hit enter.  
*Expected* - go to the page corresponding to the selected item.
*Actual* - dirty form warning.

* Chrome 15 / OSX - enter text in quick search that results in a dropdown of matches.  Use the arrow keys to highlight a match then hit enter.  
*Expected* - go to the page corresponding to the selected item.
*Actual* - go to the Studio search results page.

In terms of whether this is a regression or not (which would impact the priority), when I did same thing on sdog.

* FF 13.0.1 / OSX - enter text in quick search that results in a dropdown of matches.  Use the arrow keys to highlight a match then hit enter.  
*Expected* - go to the page corresponding to the selected item.
*Actual* - Nothing happens.

So this is not a regression.
fields.summary: OnDemand Quick search shows dirtyform warning when it should not
Automatically adding Active directory users to jira-users & jira-developers group.
JIRA start-up ASCII art no longer "has issues"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28749].
  {panel}

We want to generate the report for date/time details for the issues being in a particular status with the details like:

- Date and Time when the issue was placed in a particular status eg. "IN UAT"
- Time spent in this status. Date/time when the status was changed to another status.
- Who made this change and when

Request you to please address.

Regards,
DTS Team
fields.summary: How can we get a report of how long an issue is in each status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28748].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hey All,

Thank you all for your patience and understanding over the lifespan of this ticket.

h5. What’s the deal?
I’m pleased to say that we have completed the necessary additional functionality to include Active Objects data when importing projects. This means you can now carry over your JIRA Agile project data between instances.

h5. What’s included?
*Sprint* and *Ranking* data are considered to be the most important types of data in JIRA Agile and was included in the Active Objects being imported.

As mentioned in our previous update, the solution doesn’t include all data found in JIRA Agile. *Boards*, which harboured too much complexity to deliver in this solution within a reasonable timeframe, has been excluded from this implementation.

h5. When can I use this?
JIRA Server will need to wait until the next major release of JIRA to utilise this feature.
Due to the internal changes necessary to provide this functionality, _both the +exporting+ and +importing+ JIRA instances need to be versions which have this new implementation_. This means Active Objects *_will not_* be imported when involving any instance that is not up-to-date with this functionality.

Once again, thank you for your patience and a *big thank you* to all the beta candidates that helped during our testing program for this feature.

Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
kewilliams at atlassian dot com  
{panel}

\\

If you are looking for JIRA Agile specific data, we are tracking this separately here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10577

*Original description below*
Currently, when performing a project import, it does not restore any plugin data, including JIRA Agile (formerly GreenHopper).  This is an issue, as many customers do use both JIRA with GH integration.

With the more recent releases of plugins, information is stored within AO tables, which the project import also ignores.  Some sample information that should be included:
* Ranking
* Start/End/Release dates for versions
fields.summary: Project Imports should include relevant Active Objects data

fields.description:
In OnDemand with JIRA 5.0.6 the announcement banner in html does not get rendered anymore but displays plain text. However, with WIKI markup it works as expected. In JIRA standalone 5.0.6 this does not happen.

This was tested in Chrome and FF.
fields.summary: In OnDemand the Announcement Banner does not render html

fields.description:
The *Wiki Markup* is not rendered properly when notification email is sent through *Microsoft Outlook 2007*. Source of the email contains the proper markup. Instead of displaying the expected rendered content, it still displays the markup just like edit mode of the field.

Kindly refer to the screenshot. As you can see, the content of the *Description* is not rendered properly.
fields.summary: Outlook 2007 does not render the content of Wiki Markup properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28745].
  {panel}

In the notification mails sent from JIRA the changed and deleted text is colored by some pale green and red colors.
 If there is a lot of text this coloring scheme is easily lost in the flurry of text.
 I would suggest that the colors are made much stronger. E.g. like the strong yellow, blue or orange colors we used to use for markup on real paper back in the days.
 Pale (or pastel) colors does not stand out strongly enough for a quick overview.
fields.summary: Notification mail changed/deleted text strings are hard to find due to pale coloring

Configure Screen page,
When a long labelled custom field is part of the 'select field - fieldId', the 'Add New Tab' section breaks beyond the page border.
fields.summary: 'Add New Tab' form breaks beyond the page border, when a long labeled field is to be Added.

fields.description:
Cloning an issue with jira.clone.prefix set to null or blank results in a space prefix added to the clone. 

For illustration purposes:

starting ticket summary: 'TestingCloning3'

After first clone (and rolling the count in the summary): ' TestingCloning2'

After clone of the first clone (and rolling the count in the summary): '  TestingCloning3'

Seems to be common: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/64026/removed-clone-prefix-adds-blank-space
fields.summary: Setting jira.clone.prefix to null or blank results in a space added as a prefix

fields.description:
When defining icons for Issue Types, you can specify URL or filepath.  If the path contains a space, it will not appear with the create issue function.  It does, however, work in other situations.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a new Issue Type
* Definte a path with a space in it.
* Example:  /images/icons/space test/ico_helptest.png
* Check the Issue Type dropdown when creating a new issue

I've also attached images to show that the icon is displayed by issue navigator/issue view, but not during the create issue function.

h5. Workaround
Don't use spaces in name of the icon
fields.summary: Create issue does not show icons for custom icon images that contain a space in their filepath

fields.description:
If I enable the script debugger from IE, I can't assign an issue regarding an error in the debugger.

The error is regarding the file _batch.js_.

If I disable the debugger or mark to not see this message again, everything works fine.

And I can only replicate it on IE 7 and IE 8, it works on IE 9,Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: Can't assign issues while using script-debug in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28734].
  {panel}

I am trying to set a Workflow Post-Function to assign an Issue to a specific Role Member. I see two options:

1. Assign to Role Member

2. Assign to Last Role Member.

What I am trying to do is assign the issue to someone in the specified Role, but I want to default it to someone who is in the role but was the Reporter or has been previously assigned the issue. If no one is found then the default user for that role is fine.

I chose 2, but what I am seeing is that if there was no one in the role that has been a reporter or assignee on the issue then the assignee stays the same.
fields.summary: Combine "Assign to Role Member" and "Assign to Last Role Member" in transition

Autocomplete just the first name for @mentions in comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28727].
  {panel}

The summery of the issue gets corrupted by an additional string of characters.
this happens when the characters in the summary are non UTF-8 and the mailserver is using IMAP configuration.

Adding the following entry in the JAVA_OPTS could fix this issue: "-Dmail.mime.decodetext.strict=false"

When using the same summary and a POP server all goes well.
Attached screenshots for further reference.
fields.summary: issue summary corrupts due issue creation via email using IMAP when non UTF-8 characters are used in OnDemand

Open ProjectA in first tab, then BrojectB in second browser tab. Return to first tab with ProjectA and click "Create Issue", in the field "project" we can see projectB selected, but projectA excpected.
